name: linkedin-article-to-markdown
description: Extract LinkedIn articles and convert them to Markdown files

scripts.build: npm run build:popup && npm run build:scripts && npm run copy:assets && npm run move:files
scripts.build:scripts: esbuild src/content/ContentScript.ts src/content/article-parser.ts src/utils/*.ts --bundle --outdir=dist/temp-content --format=iife --loader:.ts=ts --platform=browser && esbuild src/background/BackgroundService.ts --bundle --outdir=dist/temp-background --format=iife --loader:.ts=ts --platform=browser
scripts.copy:assets: cp src/manifest/manifest.json dist/ && cp -r icons dist/
scripts.move:files: cd dist && cp temp-content/content/ContentScript.js . && cp temp-content/content/article-parser.js . && cp temp-content/utils/md-converter.js . && cp temp-content/utils/types.js . && cp temp-content/utils/api.js . && cp temp-background/BackgroundService.js . && rm -rf temp-content temp-background && mv index.html popup.html
scripts.test: echo 'Add your test runner here (vitest, jest, etc.)'

author: David Phillip
